title: Nuclear and Related Techniques for Climate Action in Food and Agriculture

tasks.task: Understand the role of the Joint FAO, IAEA Centre in addressing global food security threats using nuclear and biotechnological solutions.
subtasks: Analyze the interaction between soil, water, and nutrients in cropping systems using isotope and nuclear techniques.
Develop crop varieties resistant to climate change impacts through induced mutations and selective breeding.
Apply the Sterile Insect Technique (SIT) for sustainable pest management in integrated pest control.
Enhance livestock production and health through optimized feed, biodiversity characterization, and disease prevention techniques.
Ensure food safety and quality by developing analytical techniques to detect residues, contaminants, and fraud.

tasks.task: Appreciate the comprehensive approach of the Joint FAO-IAEA Centre in addressing climate change effects on agriculture and food security.
